result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc J Nylund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marc J Nylund

records.addlTxt: 01:11 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Marc J Nylund in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Defendant Marc J Nylund in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marc J Nylund appeared by video means with Attorney.  All parties and reporter by Zoom.  Court calls 22-CF-21 and 22-CF-55.  Def. agrees to do this by Zoom today.   Plea agreement:   22-CF-55/on plea to Ct. 2, Ct. 1 to be dismissed & read in.  75 days jail, costs.  22-CF-21/plea to Ct. 1 and Ct. 3, dismiss & read in Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 - sentence withheld, 3 years probation, costs, AODA, absolute sobriety, no contact with victim, complete domestic violence class and follow through, employment, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Ct. 3 - 60 days jail, imposed and stayed, 2 years probation, costs, same conditions as Ct. 1.  Waiver of preliminary examination form filed.  Court reviews with Def.  22-CF-21 - Def. waives right to preliminary hearing, Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds case over.  Def.'s Atty. has received copy of information.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form filed.  Court reviews with Def.  22-CF-21/Ct. 1 - no contest plea.  Ct. 3 - no contest plea.  22-CF-55/Ct. 2 - no contest plea.  Court grants motion to dismiss and read in for sentencing purposes: Ct. 2 of 22-CF-21 and Ct. 1 of 22-CF-55.  Court advises Def. of constitutional rights and right to jury trial.  Def. waives rights and jury trial.  Court advises Def. of elements and penalties.  Def. advised of possible deportation if not US citizen.  Court finds pleas entered freely and volutarily.  Factual basis.  Court accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of 22-CF-21/Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 and 22-CF-55/Ct. 2.  Sentencing remarks by State.  Sentencing remarks by Def.'s Atty.  Def. has nothing to say.  Court orders 22-CF-21/Ct. 1 - sentence withheld, 3 years probation, costs, DNA sample if not already done and surcharge, complete AODA assessment and follow through, maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with Karen Linsdau, complete domestic violence assessment and follow through, maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Ct. 3 - 60 days jail, huber, imposed and stayed, 2 years probation, costs, DNA sample and surcharge, same conditions as Ct. 1.  22-CF-55/Ct. 2 - 75 days jail, huber, costs, DNA surcharge.  22-CF-21/$500.00 cash bond - applied to costs in 22-CF-55, balance in 60 days.  22-CF-21/3 days credit if revoked.  22-CF-55/63 days credit.  Def. advised of voting and firearm rights.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.  State makes record about victim rights.  Probation to be served in the county Def. resides.  Jail is completed.  Any balance of bond to be applied to 22-CF-21.
DNA Order and Acknowledgement/Proof of Submission
Information for Defendant After Felony Conviction Warning Not to Possess Firearms

records.addlTxt: Court calls 22Cf21 & 22Cf55  @02:48 PM Defendant Marc J Nylund in court with attorney Cana G Kohn, via zoom.  Defendant Marc J Nylund in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marc J Nylund appeared by video means with Attorney, via zoom. Atty Kohn has copy of complaints, waives reading for both cases, bond set and requesting timely preliminary hearing for both cases. Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Maintain Absolute Sobriety,  no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, no contact with victim K.M.L or 500 feet distance of victims residence or occupied by K.M.L.

10:27 AM Defendant Marc J Nylund in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin in court.  Marc J Nylund appeared by Zoom video means.   Court calls case 22CF21 and 22CF55 and reviews. Case 22CF21 is currently a $500 cash bond that is posted and case 22CF55 the bond is currently $1,000 with conditions.  Defendant gives bail bond argument and requests signature bond.  ADA gives bail bond argument and objects to bail bond modification.  Court makes statement.  Court gives ruling.  Court grants bail bond modification on 22CF21 to $800 cash bond conditions of Maintain Absolute Sobriety,  no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, no contact with victim K.M.L or 500 feet distance of victims residence or occupied by K.M.L.  Adjourned Initial Appearance is previously scheduled. Court is adjourned.

Court calls 22CF21 & 22CF55 @ 03:45 PM Defendant Marc J Nylund in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marc J Nylund appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.  Court reviews history of case.  Court reviews Status of Counsel Report. Def. will continue to wait for atty.  Court advises def. of Nhia Lee standards and finds good cause. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court calls 22CF21 & 22CF55 @ 01:30 PM Defendant Marc J Nylund in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties via zoom.  This case was set for yesterday and we didn't get to the case until today. Court reviews history of case.  Status of counsel filed. Def. will continue to wait for counsel.  CC heard RE: preliminary examination and def. has the right to counsel, conflict in law, and Court finds good cause. State has complied with victim rights. Court adjourns. Def. heard on bail/bond recommendation.  Court would request written request and victim rights need to be complied.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No contact with K.M.L. or 500 feet from residence or occupied by K.M.L.

01:22 PM Defendant Marc J Nylund in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marc J Nylund appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.  Def. would like an attorney.  Court advised def to contact P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No contact with KML or 500 feet from residence. Def. heard on bail/bond. Court orders $1,000 cash bond with conditions. Court advise def. of p.h. rights and counsel. Def. waives time limits for p.h. Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
